body.p: Indicate the abnormal feature on the following ECG tracing.

image.alt: ECG line graph. This is an example of atrial tachycardia where the SA node is initiating too many action potentials, only some of which are getting to the ventricles.

multiple_choice.choice: The pathway the action potentials are taking during ventricular depolarization is abnormal.
The pathway the action potentials are taking during atrial depolarization is abnormal.
There are more P waves than QRS complexes.
There is a lack of T waves.

feedback.p: Incorrect. The QRS wave is normal in this case.
Incorrect. The P wave is a normal shape in this tracing.
Correct. This is an example of atrial tachycardia where the SA node is initiating too many action potentials, only some of which are getting to the ventricles.
Incorrect. Although the T waves may be hard to see, normal QRS complexes nearly always lead to normal T waves.

hint.p: Consider how the pathway of conduction affects the ECG tracing.
